page.title: 14FAMILY FUN DAY.RIPLEY.
page.content: I went to the family fun day on June 9th at Crossley Park Ripley.The Family Fun Day was organised by the East Midlands Co-op.The weather was variable some rain ,some sun and a cold breeze.My first impressions was that it looked busy and exciting rather like a carnival.There were 4 tents and several stalls and lots of people with hot dogs and drinks.From the stalls I bought two games, a box of soldiers and a few books.In the arena I saw Roy Rivers a unicyclist.He dressed as a policeman and rode his unicycle round the arena with the siren on top of his helmet flashing. Then he picked 2 boys and 2 girls from the crowd and they rode his Penny farthing.Also in the arena were sheepdog trials,2 bands and karate, judo,keep-fit,and gym demonstrations. The last fun day was in the late 1950s
